1.text: But the Spirit speaks expressly, that in latter times some shall apostatise from the faith, giving their mind to deceiving spirits and teachings of demons

2.text: speaking lies in hypocrisy, cauterised as to their own conscience,

3.text: forbidding to marry, [bidding] to abstain from meats, which God has created for receiving with thanksgiving for them who are faithful and know the truth.

4.text: For every creature of God [is] good, and nothing [is] to be rejected, being received with thanksgiving;

5.text: for it is sanctified by God’s word and freely addressing [him].

6.text: Laying these things before the brethren, thou wilt be a good minister of Christ Jesus, nourished with the words of the faith and of the good teaching which thou hast fully followed up.

7.text: But profane and old wives’ fables avoid, but exercise thyself unto piety;

8.text: for bodily exercise is profitable for a little, but piety is profitable for everything, having promise of life, of the present one, and of that to come.

9.text: The word [is] faithful and worthy of all acceptation;

10.text: for, for this we labour and suffer reproach, because we hope in a living God, who is preserver of all men, specially of those that believe.

12.text: Let no one despise thy youth, but be a model of the believers, in word, in conduct, in love, in faith, in purity.

13.text: Till I come, give thyself to reading, to exhortation, to teaching.

14.text: Be not negligent of the gift [that is] in thee, which has been given to thee through prophecy, with imposition of the hands of the elderhood.

15.text: Occupy thyself with these things; be wholly in them, that thy progress may be manifest to all.

16.text: Give heed to thyself and to the teaching; continue in them; for, doing this, thou shalt save both thyself and those that hear thee.
